page.title: 05FREDVILLE ESTATE.
page.content: The Fredville estate covers about 2000 acres and is situated in and around the village of Nonington. The name Fredville means cold place and comes from the French "froid de ville". There was a big manor house there but this was burned down during the second world war. The estate dates back to the eleventh century. The Plumptre family ,who own Fredville today, moved into Fredville in 1750. When the presnt Mr. Plumptre's grandfather lived at Fredville there were twelve children in the family, that is quite a lot of children, and he had to have a nursery wing built onto the house. In Fredville Park there is an old oak tree,called Majesty, famous for having the largest girth measuring 11.60m.
